pages.text: A powerful blast of wild earth magic shatters most blocks. By default, this is in a two-block pattern: the block you are targeting, the one directly below it (based off the angle you target the block).$(br2)With modifiers, you can extend this significantly: digging high, wider, and deeper, with silk touch, fortune, and even teleporting all drops to you.

pages.title: Spell Configuration
pages.text: $(bold)Cooldown:$() The spell has a cooldown of $(spell:shatter/SECONDS/cooldown) seconds.$(br2)$(bold)Distance:$() The maximum range of the beam for breaking is $(spell:shatter/distance) blocks.$(br2)$(bold)Size:$() By default, the beam will break blocks width a width of $(spell:shatter/default_width) (with 0 being 1 block), a height of $(spell:shatter/default_height) (with 0 being 2 blocks: the block and the block below), and a depth of $(spell:shatter/default_depth) (with 0 being 1 block broken).

$(bold)Width:$() With the $(modifier:wider)$() modifier, $(spell:shatter/width) block(s) are added on either side. A value of 1 would mean three blocks in a row are broken.$(br2)$(bold)Height:$() With the $(modifier:taller)$() modifier enabled, $(spell:shatter/height) block(s) are added on either side. A value of 1 would mean three blocks in a column are broken.$(br2)$(bold)Depth:$() With the $(modifier:deeper)$() modifier, $(spell:shatter/depth) blocks are added to the default. A value of 2 would mean that up to three blocks are broken behind the

initial block, for a total of three blocks broken (if the default depth is 0).$(br2)$(bold)Single:$() With the $(modifier:singularity)$() modifier enabled, a single block is broken by default (instead of two).$(br2)$(bold)Magnetism:$() With the $(modifier:magnetic_ray)$() modifier enabled, all of the broken blocks are their drops are teleported to your location.$(br2)$(bold)Silk Touch:$() With the $(modifier:shatter_silk_touch)$() modifier enabled, blocks

are broken as though the Silk Touch enchantment was used.$(br2)$(bold)Fortune:$() With the $(modifier:shatter_fortune)$() modifier enabled, blocks are broken as though enchanted with Fortune II.$(br2)$(bold)Smelting:$() With the $(modifier:smelting_ray)$() modifier enabled, blocks that are broken are smelted as though cooked in a furnace.$(br2)$(bold)Moss:$() With the $(modifier:moss_harvest)$() modifier enabled, blocks are processed as though with a knife to obtain $(l:herbs/terra_moss)terra moss$().
$(bold)Voiding:$() With $(modifier:shatter_void)$() modifier enabled, blocks are destroyed completely rather than broken.
